FuncDef: The display mvpn ipmsi command displays multicast virtual private network (MVPN) inclusive-provider multicast service interface (I-PMSI) tunnel configurations.
CLIs: display mvpn { all-instance | vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> } ipmsi [ verbose [ <grpAddr> | <srcAddr> ] * ]

ParaDef.Info:
Displays I-PMSI tunnel configurations of all instances.
-

Displays I-PMSI tunnel configurations of a specified VPN instance.
vpn-instance-name specifies the name of a VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. In addition, the VPN instance name must not be _public_. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Displays I-PMSI tunnel configurations of a specified multicast group address.
group-address specifies a multicast group address.
The value ranges from 224.0.1.0 to 239.255.255.255, in dotted decimal notation.

Displays I-PMSI tunnel configurations of a specified multicast source address.
source-address specifies a multicast source address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Examples: MVPN local I-PMSI information for VPN-Instance: mcast1
MVPN local I-PMSI information for VPN-Instance: mcast1
<HUAWEI> display mvpn vpn-instance mcast1 ipmsi verbose
MVPN local I-PMSI information for VPN-Instance: mcast1
MVPN local I-PMSI information for VPN-Instance: mcast2
MVPN local I-PMSI information for VPN-Instance: mcast2
<HUAWEI> display mvpn vpn-instance VPNA ipmsi verbose 225.1.1.1 10.1.3.1
MVPN local I-PMSI information for VPN-Instance: VPNA
<HUAWEI> display mvpn vpn-instance VPNA ipmsi verbose 225.1.1.1 10.1.3.1
MVPN local I-PMSI information for VPN-Instance: VPNA
MVPN local I-PMSI information for VPN-Instance: vrf1
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After a Next Generation MVPN (NG MVPN) is configured, run the display mvpn ipmsi command to check MVPN I-PMSI tunnel configurations of a specified VPN instance to that you can determine whether the NG MVPN is working properly. Running the display mvpn ipmsi command on the root node of a point-to-multipoint (P2MP) tunnel displays MVPN I-PMSI tunnel configurations of the root node and all leaf nodes. Running the display mvpn ipmsi command on a leaf node of a P2MP tunnel displays MVPN I-PMSI tunnel configurations of the leaf node and the root node.
Precautions
If an I-PMSI tunnel is not established, no command output is displayed for the display mvpn ipmsi command.
